caption: Table 1: Comparisons of our results with the state-of-the-art in non-stationary RL. Here, ΔΡ, ΔΡ and ∆** are defined in (6) and (7); and ∆ʹ and ∆' measure the RL loss function variations. We introduce DT(∆∞, Δ) := min {√A£T, T2/3△1/3}.
description: This table compares the dynamic regret bounds achieved by MetaCURL with those of the state-of-the-art non-stationary RL algorithms. It highlights that MetaCURL achieves optimal dynamic regret without prior knowledge of MDP changes and handles adversarial losses, unlike other methods.
